item.title: Kevin add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "When I think of all I have to be thankful for I wonder that You just don't kill me now because You've done so much for me already & I haven't been particularly grateful." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Man's desire for God is bedded in his unconscious & seeks to satisfy itself in physical possession of another human. This necessarily is a passing, fading attachment in its sensuous aspects since it is a poor substitute for what the unconscious is after." -- Flannery O'Connor
